Political career: 2015 : Vice-president of the Île-de-France region in charge of housing and urban planning
2017 : Vice-president of the Île-de-France region in charge of housing, urban planning and attractiveness
Professional career: 2002-2004 : Associate of the law firm Skadden Arps Slate Meagher & Flom (New York)
2004-2005 : Associate of the law firm Veil Jourde (Paris)
2011-2014 : Adviser to the Union for a Popular Movement (UMP)
2015- ... : Partner of the law firm Carbonnier Lamaze Rasle (Paris)
Education (qualifications and diplomas): 2000 : DEA in Business Law from Paris II Panthéon Assas
2001 : Master of Laws from Columbia University (New York)
2002 : Research Scholar at Harvard Law School
2005 : Lawyer at the New York Bar
Other activities: 2017 : President of the Île-de-France public land-management body (EPFIF)
